intro: Actinella simplex, commonly known as the simple actinella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
